channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: Meta and TikTok are obstructing researchers' access to data, EU commission rules
Crunchyroll is destroying its subtitles for no good reason
item.description:
For comparison, here’s the kind of presentation quality that first-party subtitles were providing just earlier this year: Screenshot from Ruri Rocks (Summer 2025, Crunchyroll) Screenshot from Ruri Rocks (Summer 2025, Crunchyroll) Screenshot from Ruri Rocks (Summer 2025, Crunchyroll) Screenshot from Ruri Rocks (Summer 2025, Crunchyroll) Given the technical capabilities on display in the above screenshots, it should be clear that first-party subtitles for Fall 2025 shows shouldn’t look as bad as they do. Lots of on-screen text is even left straight up untranslated. Screenshot from The Demon Girl Next Door (Summer 2019, Hidive) Screenshot from Is the Order a Rabbit.

Read more

item.title: Raspberry Pi Pico Bit-Bangs 100 Mbit/S Ethernet
item.description:
Brian Tristam Williams Raspberry Pi RP2040 or RP2350 Bit-Bangs 100 Mbit/s Ethernet October 22, 2025 by Brian Tristam Williams on Embedded Programming Raspberry Pi RP2040 Raspberry Pi Pico + Wireless & Communication Embedded & AI Embedded AI News Wireless Communication News RP2350 Three years after the popular Pico-10BASE-T experiment and following bit-banged USB in 2023, developer Steve Markgraf now bit-bangs 100 Mbit/s Fast Ethernet on the Raspberry Pi Pico using only software and PIO. Bit-banging 100 Mbps Ethernet on a Raspberry Pi Pico. Get Started with MicroPython on Raspberry Pi Pico (2nd Edition) €18.

Read more

item.title: Responses from LLMs are not facts
item.description:
Sure, you might get an answer that’s right or advice that's good… but what “books” are it “remembering” when it gives that answer. That answer or advice is a common combination of words, not a fact. ” Sometimes that can be helpful or insightful.

Read more

item.title: How the U.S. National Science Foundation Enabled Software-Defined Networking
item.description:
All of this changed with software-defined networking (SDN), where network owners took control over how their networks behaved. First, network devices should offer a common open interface directly to their packet-forwarding logic. Second, a network should have logically centralized control, where the control software has network-wide visibility and direct control across the distributed collection of network devices.

Read more

item.title: OS/2 Warp, PowerPC Edition
item.description:
), IBM finally “shipped” OS/2 Warp, PowerPC edition. The desktop Power Series machines were IDE based, ThinkPads used SCSI disks. The Power Series systems were closely related to certain IBM RS/6000 workstations.
